items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 priced over $400, expected to sell strong
items.summary:
- Nintendo's upcoming console, Switch 2, anticipated for strong sales despite a price over $400.
- Increased production costs include an upgraded Nvidia chip costing an estimated $130 to $150 per unit.
- Launch titles expected from popular franchises such as Mario Kart, Pokémon, and Metroid Prime, plus third-party games like Call of Duty.
- Switch 2 will compete with PlayStation 5 and feature backward compatibility with existing Switch games.
- More details to be revealed in an online presentation on Apr. 2.

items.title: Foxconn expects profit rise on AI server demand
items.summary:
- Foxconn anticipates a 2.35% increase in fourth-quarter profits due to strong AI server demand.
- Estimated net profit for October to December 2024 is US$1.65 billion.
- Fourth-quarter revenue rose by 15.2%, setting a record backed by AI server sales.
- The company expects first-quarter performance to surpass the average of the past five years, indicating significant year-over-year growth.

items.title: India’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
Singapore caregiving startup Homage hits financial breakeven
items.summary:
- Homage has achieved financial breakeven across its operations.
- This milestone follows over a year focused on streamlining operations and financial sustainability.
- The company continues to prioritize personal care services and caregiver support.
- Homage is included in The Straits Times’ list of fastest-growing companies for 2025, reflecting its growth and expansion.

items.title: SoftBank to build $677m AI data center in former Sharp factory
items.summary:
- SoftBank is transforming a former Sharp LCD panel factory in Osaka, Japan, into a data center for AI initiatives. 
- Estimated investment for the project is $677.05 million, with operations set to begin in 2026. 
- The data center will have a power capacity of 150 megawatts, making it one of the largest in Japan. 
- The initiative aims to localize and commercialize AI agent models developed by OpenAI, focusing on custom applications using proprietary data from clients.

items.title: Grab CEO warns AI crucial for growth, non-users risk lagging
items.author: Anthony Tan
items.summary:
- Grab CEO Anthony Tan emphasized the need for AI adoption at Converge Live in Singapore, warning that non-users risk falling behind.
- Highlighted Grab's AI solutions like the 'driver co-pilot' for optimizing job matches and reducing passenger wait times.
- Reported 2024 revenue of US$2.8 billion, a 19% increase, and completed a nine-week 'generative AI sprint' to create merchant tools.
- Tan aims to expand AI use across Grab's 7,000 employees, personally leveraging AI for coding and productivity.
- Reinforced Grab's commitment to integrating AI in all services to support entrepreneurs.

items.title: Tesla China sees Model Y orders surge after 51.5% sales drop
items.summary:
- Tesla received over 200,000 orders for the updated Model Y SUV in mainland China.
- The Model Y starts at US$36,292, following a significant 51.5% drop in sales last month.
- Tesla plans to increase production at its Shanghai Gigafactory to meet delivery demands.
- In February 2025, Tesla's sales in China fell to 30,688 units, the lowest since July 2022.
- This represented a 51.5% decrease from January and a 49.2% drop compared to February 2024.

items.title: Israeli fintech firm Rapyd buys PayU, raises $500m
Focus leads to fortune for RedDoorz in 2024
Mini Korea unveils all-electric family lineup
items.summary:
- Mini Korea introduced its all-electric lineup at the BMW Driving Center, featuring the Cooper, Countryman, and Aceman models.
- The Aceman is a new, exclusively electric model that sits between the Cooper and Countryman, maintaining Mini’s “go-kart” driving dynamics.
- The all-electric Cooper has 218 horsepower, a 300-kilometer range, and starts at 52.5 million won (US$36,100).
- The Countryman EV delivers up to 313 horsepower with notable performance tested from Gimpo to Incheon.
- The Aceman, a compact electric SUV, offers a 312-kilometer range, suitable for city and leisure driving.
- All models feature circular OLED displays by Samsung Display.
- Mini Korea celebrates 20 years in the market, having sold over 126,000 vehicles, with the Countryman leading the premium small SUV segment last year with over 2,800 units sold.

items.title: Tesla expands in India with filings, new showroom
items.summary:
- Tesla begins the homologation process for Model Y and Model 3 in India to meet local regulations.
- One application has been approved, totaling nine homologation applications.
- The company has leased its first showroom located in Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai.

items.title: Publisher proceeds ex-Meta employee’s book publication
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Flatiron Books, a division of Macmillan, will publish a book by Sarah Wynn-Williams, a former Meta employee.
- The book, *Careless People: A Cautionary Tale of Power, Greed, and Lost Idealism*, discusses alleged misconduct and harassment at Meta.
- The publication faces legal challenges due to a severance agreement Wynn-Williams signed in 2017, which includes an arbitration ruling against disparaging Meta.
- Macmillan stated the arbitration ruling does not affect the claims in the book and confirmed it underwent a thorough editorial process.
- Meta has not yet commented on the situation.

items.title: Surveillance firm Flock Safety nets $275m led by A16z
items.summary:
- Flock Safety raised US$275 million in a funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz, reaching a valuation of US$7.5 billion.
- Total funding has exceeded US$950 million, with additional investors including Greenoaks Capital and Bedrock Capital.
- Plans include developing US-manufactured drones by 2025 and building a 100,000-square-foot facility in Georgia.
- The company collaborates with over 4,800 law enforcement agencies and nearly 1,000 businesses, with enterprise clients contributing 30% of revenue.
- Annual recurring revenue surpassed US$300 million, marking a 70% increase from the previous year.
- Flock recently appointed Brandon Simins as CFO, indicating preparations for a potential public listing without a set timeline.

items.title: Huawei’s HarmonyOS surpasses iOS in China
items.summary:
- Huawei’s HarmonyOS exceeded Apple’s iOS in market share in mainland China for four consecutive quarters in 2024.
- By December 2024, HarmonyOS held a 19% market share, up from 16% in 2023.
- Android remains the leader with a 64% market share, while iOS fell to 17%, down from 20% in the same quarter of 2023.

items.title: Apple adds real-time translation to AirPods in iOS 19
items.summary:
- Apple is developing real-time translation for AirPods, set to be included in a future iOS 19 update.
- Functionality allows translation of in-person conversations between two languages using an iPhone.
- This feature aims to enhance bilingual communication and compete with Google Pixel Buds' existing translation capabilities.

items.title: Meta to test community notes feature in US
items.summary:
- Meta is introducing a community notes feature on Facebook, Instagram, and Threads, starting testing on Mar. 18 in the US.
- This feature allows contributors to write and rate contextual notes on shared content, similar to X's system, with around 200,000 potential contributors signed up.
- The rating system will be based on X's open-source algorithm, marking a shift in Meta's content management strategy to improve content moderation.

items.title: Domestic makers hold nearly 50% of China robotics market: report
items.summary:
- China's domestic manufacturers hold nearly 50% of the robotics market, up from 30% in 2020.
- Chinese companies are moving into higher-end segments of robotics, moving beyond low-end markets.
- Unitree Robotics has developed the humanoid G1 robot without using American components.
- Intelligent robotics could significantly boost production capacity in various sectors.
- China is uniquely positioned for large-scale automation, potentially impacting other economies, especially the US.
- Increased competition may push the US to enhance its own automation efforts.

items.title: Ex-Samsung engineer expands racism lawsuit to South Korea HQ
items.summary:
- Allegations of racism at Samsung have expanded to include Samsung Electronics’ headquarters in South Korea.
- Andrew Mo, a former senior engineer, claims wrongful termination after reporting a racist remark.
- The lawsuit was originally filed in December 2022, following his dismissal in January 2022.
- Mo alleges retaliation for his report of a comment suggesting the exclusion of 'people with dark skin' from a demonstration.
- In February 2025, Mo modified his lawsuit to add Samsung Electronics and its US unit as defendants.

items.title: Chinese AI startup raises $69m from state-owned firm
items.summary:
- Zhipu AI, a Chinese AI firm, has secured approximately US$69.04 million from state-owned Huafa Group.
- The investment was announced on Mar. 13, following a prior funding of 1 billion yuan from various investors, including Hangzhou City Investment Group Industrial Fund.
- Huafa Group stated the funds will enhance technological advancements and support the development of Zhipu AI’s General Language Model (GLM).
- Founded in 2019, Zhipu AI has previously attracted funding from major tech companies like Tencent, Meituan, and Xiaomi through over 15 funding rounds.

items.title: China’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article explores recent investment trends in China's startup scene.
- It includes sections on notable investors and companies, as well as macro trends in funding across various verticals and stages.
- It is a premium content, requiring a subscription for full access to charts and detailed visuals.

items.title: Astrotalk names ex-GlobalBees president as chief business officer
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Damandeep Singh Soni has been appointed as the Chief Business Officer of Astrotalk Store.
- Soni previously served at GlobalBees and left in August 2024.
- He has experience with companies like boAt and MilkBasket, and will manage ecommerce operations including selling gemstones and healing accessories.
- Astrotalk, founded in 2017, primarily offers online astrology consultations.

items.title: Indian retailer firm bags $40m series E
items.author: Abhishek Agarwal
items.summary:
- Purple Style Labs has raised $40 million in its Series E funding round.
- The funding comprised 40% primary infusion and 60% secondary share sale.
- Investors include SageOne Flagship Growth OE Fund, Alchemy Long Term Ventures Fund, Minerva Ventures Fund, and Bajaj Holdings and Investment.
- Founded in 2015, Purple Style Labs operates Pernia’s Pop-Up Shop and manages 15 experience centers across India and one in London.
- The company plans to use the funds to expand domestically and internationally in cities like New York, Los Angeles, Dubai, Mumbai, and Delhi, as well as Tier II markets in India.

items.title: Kakao founder resigns due to health issues
items.summary:
- Kim Beom-su resigns as co-chair of Kakao's Corporate Alignment Council due to health concerns.
- CEO Chung Shin-a becomes the sole chair; the council oversees Kakao's strategic direction and operations.
- Kim will continue leading Kakao’s Future Initiative Center focusing on long-term strategies.
- His resignation follows an ongoing legal investigation into stock price manipulation during Kakao's acquisition of SM Entertainment; he was arrested in July 2024 and released on bail in October.
- Kakao plans to spin off its web portal unit, Daum, into a standalone company for agile decision-making.

items.title: Naver launches AI-powered ecommerce app to rival Coupang
items.summary:
- Naver has launched the Naver Plus Store, an AI-powered ecommerce app, available on Google Play and soon on Apple App Store.
- The app uses AI for personalized recommendations based on user demographics and shopping behavior.
- Naver partnered with CJ Logistics for same-day and next-day delivery and free returns.
- Naver relies on third-party sellers, which may slow its competitiveness against Coupang’s logistics.
- Naver has 44.1 million monthly active users but Coupang leads in paid memberships with over 14 million versus Naver’s 4.6 million.
- The launch signifies Naver's strategic move into ecommerce, though it's unclear if it can rival Coupang effectively.

items.title: SG’s NRP launches RoboNexus to boost robotics startups globally
items.summary:
- The National Robotics Programme (NRP) has launched RoboNexus, an accelerator for robotics startups and SMEs.
- RoboNexus aims to enhance international visibility for Singapore-based companies.
- The program started its pilot phase in September 2024, offering mentorship and business development support.
- During the pilot, six companies, including LionsBot and dConstruct Robotics, participated.
- Registrations for robotics startups in Singapore are currently open.

items.title: Samsung at risk as TSMC eyes Intel foundry partnership
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics faces challenges in the foundry market as TSMC explores a joint venture with Nvidia, AMD, and Broadcom regarding Intel's semiconductor facilities.
- If the partnership occurs, competition could intensify, with Samsung already losing market share, having reported an operating loss of over 2 trillion won (US$1.4 billion) in its foundry division.
- TSMC holds 67.1% of global foundry revenue as of Q4 2024, compared to Samsung's 8.1%.
- With TSMC securing clients like Apple and Nvidia, Samsung struggles to compete, especially under rising AI chip demand.
- Samsung's chip plant in Taylor, Texas, is nearly completed, but attracting customers remains a major hurdle.

items.title: Telegram’s crypto wallet adds trading, yield options
items.summary:
- Telegram's crypto wallet has introduced new features for trading and yield options.
- Users can now engage in trading directly within the wallet.
- The update aims to enhance user experiences in the cryptocurrency ecosystem.

items.title: China’s UBTech launches $41k life-size humanoid robot
items.summary:
- UBTech Robotics unveils the Tien Kung Xingzhe humanoid robot for research applications, priced at approximately US$41,200. 
- The robot, standing 1.7 meters tall, is designed for strength and stability and can integrate advanced features like lidars and Nvidia’s Jetson Orin. 
- It can walk at speeds up to 10 km/h and traverse various terrains including slopes, stairs, sand, and snow. 
- Pre-orders are open, with expected delivery in Q2 2025.

items.title: Xiaomi to preinstall PhonePe’s app store in India
items.summary:
- Xiaomi will preinstall PhonePe's app store on its devices in India.
- This move aims to enhance user experience by providing access to regional apps.
- PhonePe is a prominent digital payments platform in India, expanding its ecosystem through this partnership.

items.title: Weekly funding: Zolve raises $251m
items.summary:
- A list compiling weekly startup funding activities across Asia.
- Highlights top 10 investment deals of the week.
- Access to full details and funding rounds requires a subscription.

items.title: A cheat sheet of M&As in India
items.summary:
[Since 2006, Tech in Asia has tracked India’s M&A landscape.]
[M&A deal counts and sizes have increased significantly over time.]
[The article provides an analysis of M&A trends, leaderboards, and a database of deals.]

items.title: Edtech firm Physics Wallah revamps leadership ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- Physics Wallah is revamping its leadership in preparation for an initial public offering (IPO).
- The company has appointed three independent directors: Nitin Savara, Rachna Dikshit, and Deepak Amitabh.
- Prateek Boob's title has changed from executive director to wholetime director for a five-year term starting from February 12, 2025.

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity firm ActiveFence lays off 22 employees
items.summary:
- ActiveFence, an Israeli cybersecurity firm, has laid off 22 employees.
- The layoffs come as the company adjusts to market conditions.
- ActiveFence specializes in protecting platforms from disinformation and harmful content, highlighting the challenges in the sector.

items.title: Investment firm Groww in talks to acquire wealthtech startup
items.summary:
- Groww is in discussions to acquire Fisdom, a wealthtech startup backed by PayU.
- The deal might value Fisdom between US$140 million and US$160 million.
- Groww is also considering acquiring other wealthtech firms.
- Fisdom is seeking funding from private equity and evaluating financing options but is currently considering Groww's interest.
- Neither company has commented on the discussions.

items.title: Deliveroo delays margin target, shares drop 9%
items.summary:
- Deliveroo postponed its margin growth forecast, causing shares to drop by 9% on Mar. 13.
- The company reported its first statutory profit of £2.9 million in 2024, a turnaround from the £31.8 million loss in 2023.
- CEO Will Shu announced that the 4% core earnings margin target will now be achieved from 2026 due to market challenges.
- Deliveroo is exiting the Hong Kong market and selling assets to Foodpanda, while remaining active in seven other markets.
- Analysts expressed concerns over the delayed margin target despite a rise in gross transaction value in late 2024.

items.title: Mapping the rise of humanoid robotics companies worldwide
items.summary: - The first cinematic depiction of a machine with a human brain was in the film Metropolis (1927). - Recent months have seen a surge of releases of humanoid robots designed to function like humans. - Humanoid robots are considered easier to develop due to existing human-centric environments for data training. - They offer more flexibility than specialized industrial robots, aiding in labor shortages in aging societies. - Jensen Huang from Nvidia highlights the significance of humanoids for future AI developments. - Hanafiah Yussof from Robopreneur discusses challenges in creating humanoid robots, referencing Malaysia's first prototype. - Public interest in humanoid robots significantly increased after Elon Musk's unveiling of the Optimus prototype in 2022.

items.title: Singapore grants bail in alleged $390m Nvidia chip fraud
items.summary:
- A Singapore court has granted bail to three men accused of defrauding suppliers of server computers containing Nvidia chips.
- The suspects include two Singaporean men and one Chinese national, with bail set at S$800,000, S$600,000, and S$1 million respectively.
- They were charged for allegedly smuggling Nvidia chips and deceiving Dell and Super Micro about the servers' intended locations, involving a total value of approximately US$390 million.

items.title: 50 rising AI startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists AI startups in Asia that have recently raised funding.
- It focuses on startups up to the series E funding stage.
- Each entry provides key details about the respective funding round.

items.title: Lalamove reaffirms fair, transparent order dispatch in China
items.summary:
- Huolala (Lalamove outside China) announced an initiative to enhance algorithm transparency and fairness in its order dispatch system.
- Key measures to ensure ethical practices while safeguarding driver rights and platform security were outlined.
- The system claims to engage in no data abuse, discriminatory pricing, or unfair treatment of users.
- Pricing and service quality are not influenced by user device type, location, or registration time.
- Drivers are not forced to accept orders, reaffirming a commitment to fairness and transparency.

items.title: Lalamove unveils algorithm transparencies in China
items.summary:
- Huolala (Lalamove outside China) announces initiative for algorithm transparency in order dispatch system.
- Key measures focus on ethical algorithm practices, safeguarding driver rights, and platform security.
- Company assures no data abuse, discriminatory pricing, or unfair treatment of users affects pricing or service quality.
- Drivers are not forced to accept orders, promoting fairness and transparency on the platform.

items.title: SEA’s allure pulls global investors
items.summary:
- Investors are increasingly interested in Southeast Asia due to ongoing US-China tensions.
- Singapore's financial and industrial sectors are performing well, while Malaysia has opportunities through the Johor-Singapore Special Economic Zone.
- Key sectors attracting investment include banking and semiconductors in both countries.
- Southeast Asia is expected to benefit from increasing foreign direct investment despite the lack of a true 'safe haven'.
- Singaporean AI startup Ai Palette has been acquired by UK-based GlobalData, enhancing its market intelligence capabilities.

items.title: GoTo posts full-year adjusted profit amid merger whispers
items.summary:
- GoTo Group reported a 93% increase in net revenue for 2024 and achieved positive annual adjusted EBITDA for the first time, despite still being loss-making.
- The company received US$38 million in service fees from Tokopedia, holding a 25% stake in the latter.
- GoTo is reportedly in merger talks with Grab, and combined operations may lead to market advantages, although regulatory clearance is uncertain.
- GoTo's fintech segment saw significant growth, with gross revenue up by 95% and outstanding consumer loans increasing 2.7 times year-on-year.
- The company anticipates adjusted earnings between US$87 million and US$99 million in 2024, more than double the previous year.

items.title: 20 largest exits in Indonesia
Chinese tech firm Monica raises new funding led by Tencent
items.summary:
- Tencent led a financing round for Monica, the parent company of Manus.
- This marks Tencent’s second partnership with Monica’s founder, Xiao Hong, after an earlier investment in Weiban Assistant.
- Monica is associated with Beijing Red Butterfly Technology Co., Ltd., founded in July 2023.
- Monica also operates Beijing Butterfly Effect Technology Co., Ltd., established in April 2022, co-owned by Feng Qionghua and Xue Fengying.

items.title: Intel appoints new CEO to lead recovery efforts
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Lip-Bu Tan has been appointed CEO of Intel to strengthen its position in the semiconductor market.
- Tan has a background in nuclear engineering from MIT and an MBA from California, and he founded Walden International in 1987 for early-stage semiconductor investments.
- He previously served as CEO of Cadence Design Systems, where he revived the company and established partnerships with TSMC and Apple.
- Recent developments at Intel include:
  - **10-Mar-2025**: Intel gets initial approval for a private power plant in Israel aimed at producing up to 650 megawatts of power.
  - **02-Mar-2025**: Intel delays a $28 billion Ohio chip project to 2030 due to cost cuts leading to job reductions.
  - **26-Feb-2025**: Intel-backed Ignite launches new deeptech accelerator programs for startups.
  - **19-Feb-2025**: Intel stock surges 16% amid speculation of a potential breakup, marking its biggest single-day gain since March 2020.
  - **12-Feb-2025**: Intel appoints Karin Eibschitz Segal as interim data center chief.
  - **07-Feb-2025**: Intel announces the cut of 58 jobs as part of a strategy to save $10 billion by 2025.

items.title: Alibaba launches new AI assistant app Quark
items.summary:
- Alibaba has released an upgraded version of its Quark application, which now uses its Qwen-based reasoning model.
- Quark is the first consumer-facing service from Alibaba utilizing its proprietary AI models.
- New features include an AI chatbot, advanced research capabilities, and task execution tools aimed at various tasks like academic research, document drafting, image generation, medical diagnostics, and travel planning.
- Recent developments from Alibaba include plans for all sellers to use AI by 2025 and significant investments in AI and cloud computing.

items.title: Adobe shares fall 4% after strong Q1 performance
items.summary:
- Adobe projects Q2 revenue between US$5.77 billion and US$5.82 billion, meeting Wall Street expectations.
- Stock dropped over 4% following the announcement but the annual revenue outlook remains unchanged.
- In Q1, Adobe reported US$5.71 billion in revenue, surpassing analyst expectations of US$5.66 billion with adjusted earnings per share at US$5.08, exceeding the forecast of US$4.97.

items.title: Anthropic CEO warns of Chinese espionage in US AI firms
items.author: Dario Amodei
items.summary:
- Dario Amodei, CEO of Anthropic, warns about Chinese espionage targeting US AI companies.
- Remarks made during a Council on Foreign Relations event on March 10.
- Amodei states that sensitive algorithmic information is at risk, with some lines of code valued over $100 million.
- He expressed concerns that espionage attempts might already be underway.
- Amodei urges the US government to improve protective measures for AI firms.

items.title: Google unveils Gemini AI models to enhance robotics tasks
items.summary:
- Google launches Gemini Robotics and Gemini Robotics-ER AI models as part of the Gemini 2.0 framework on Mar. 12.
- Gemini Robotics integrates vision, language, and action for task performance; Robotics-ER enhances environmental understanding and reasoning.
- Designed for factory systems, warehouse automation, and humanoid robots, with testing conducted on ALOHA 2.
- Future adaptations planned for Apptronik’s Apollo robot.

items.title: Ex-Zomato COO launches aerospace startup LAT
items.author: Surobhi Das, Deepinder Goyal
items.summary:
- Former Zomato COO, Surobhi Das, launches LAT Aerospace, focusing on low-cost regional air travel.
- Zomato CEO, Deepinder Goyal, joins as a non-executive cofounder and invests US$20 million.
- LAT Aerospace is developing STOL aircraft with a range of 1,500 km and a capacity for 24 passengers.
- The startup is in stealth mode and plans to create compact 'air-stops' needing minimal airport infrastructure.
